brewery.brewery_description:
London Fields was the first brewery in Hackney for over 100 years and started out brewing from the railway arches that sheltered us during the London Riots of 2011.
We’ve endured through turbulent times and scandal in the heart of East London – Love not War is our origins – and we’ve revived it via support for local charities and artists within our community.
We’re now brewing flavourful, balanced and accessible beer, in our spanking new brewery – back where it all started – under the arches in London Fields.

beer.beer_description: The Hackney Hopster is a debonair young chap of a pacific pale ale. Dressed in New Zealand & US hops, the Hopster shows off flavours of grapefruit, lemon zest and gooseberry, with a dry and fresh finish.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 240 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 49!

beer.beer_description: The Hackney Hopster is a debonair young chap of a pacific pale ale. Dressed in New Zealand & US hops, the Hopster shows off flavours of grapefruit, lemon zest and gooseberry, with a dry and fresh finish.

user.bio: Ik hou van bier, the piss of angels, the golden liquid, the mother of all drinks!

items.checkin_comment: Plenty of bananary flavours up front like a wheat beer but a citrus aftertaste like an IPA. Weird combo but it does work. Out for Hockey Christmas do after a 2-0 win

beer.beer_description: An inventive fusion between an IPA and a German wheat beer, 3 Weiss Monkeys features a wheat beer yeast, which gives you banana on the nose, then dry-hopped with US hops for a citrusy balance. A favourite of beer writers.

An inventive fusion between an IPA and a German wheat beer, 3 Weiss Monkeys features a wheat beer yeast, which gives you banana on the nose, then dry-hopped with US hops for a citrusy balance. A favourite of beer writers.

In the 18th century, the British in India faced a serious plight. Beer was rendered tired and flat by the journey from England. India Pale Ale was the solution. The brew was more potent, made with extra hops to preserve strong characters.
This IPA has been crafted for Dishoom by London Fields Brewery. It is brewed with Cascade, Citra and Pacifica hops to deliver the requisite aroma, fruitiness and clean bitterness. Its bold, vigorous character holds up formidably against the strong flavours in Dishoom food.

items.badge_description: Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 40 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 9!

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 150 distinct venues!

Wine isn't the only beverage worthy of pairing with a delicious meal. With so many styles widely available, there’s a perfect pint for any cuisine of your choosing. That's a beer at 70 different venues categorized as a Restaurant. Try 5 more for Level 15!
Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 150 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 31!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 150 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 31.

beer.beer_description:
Unfiltered, no nonsense, pilsner lager brewed to style. 
Classic Mittelfruh meets Lemondrop hops for refreshing bitterness with new wave lemony zing. 
Clean finish comes from proper lager yeast and a four week process.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 95 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 20!
